definition: شرف šarufa (šaraf, شرافة šarāfa) to be highborn, high-bred, noble, illustrious, eminent, distinguished, high-ranking II to mako noble, eminent, illustrious, ennoble, clevate, exalt, raise to distinction, honor, (ه s.o.), confer honor or distinction (ه up on s.o.); to honor (ه s.o. with); to give (ه s.o.) the honor III to vie for precedence in honor or nobility (ه with s.o.); to approach (ه s.th.), come within sight (ه of s.th.), be within shooting distance (ه of s.th.); to overlook, command (ه s.th.), look down (ه on s.th.); to supervise, control (ه s.th.), watch (ه over s.th.) IV to be high, tall, lofty; to tower, rise (على above); to look down (على on). overlook, overtop (على s.th.); to command (على the vicinity, etc.); to open, face (على on, e.g., a window on the garden); to look down (على upon s.th.): to be a spectator, look on (على at): to supervise, oversee, superintend. contorl (على s.th.), watch, have the super vision (على over), manage, direct, run (على s.th.), be in charge (على of s.th.); to be near s.th. (على), be close (على to s.th.), be on the point of (على); to be on the verge or brink (على of ruin, etc.) V to be honored (ب with), have the honor, give o.s. the honor (ب of), تشرفنا tašarrafnā it is (was) an honor to me X to stretch oneself up; to tower over s.th.; to look over or down; to look, peer (الى at); to look out, watch (الى for); to review (ه s.th.); to view, tour (ه s.th.), see the sights (ه of); to catch sight (ه of), see (ه s.th.) شرف šaraf elevated place شرف šaraf high rank, nobility, distinc tion, eminence, dignity; honor, glory | in his honor على شرفه
